metadata.Title: CVE-2022-21723 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: PJSIP is a free and open source multimedia communication library written in C language implementing standard based protocols such as SIP, SDP, RTP, STUN, TURN, and ICE. In versions 2.11.1 and prior, parsing an incoming SIP message that contains a malformed multipart can potentially cause out-of-bound read access. This issue affects all PJSIP users that accept SIP multipart. The patch is available as commit in the `master` branch. There are no known workarounds.

criterions.comment: pjproject: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
ring: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
